text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Cost 0..*BaseCost OMOP Table
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
cost_id 1..1integerCost Identifier
cost_event_id 1..1integerCost Event Identifier
cost_domain_id 1..1stringCost Domain Identifier
cost_type_concept_id 1..1Reference(Concept OMOP Table)Cost Type
currency_concept_id 0..1Reference(Concept OMOP Table)Currency
total_charge 0..1integerTotal Charge
total_cost 0..1integerTotal Cost
total_paid 0..1integerTotal Paid
paid_by_payer 0..1integerPaid by Payer
paid_by_patient 0..1integerPaid by Patient
paid_patient_copay 0..1integerPaid Patient Copay
paid_patient_coinsurance 0..1integerPaid Patient Coinsurance
paid_patient_deductible 0..1integerPaid Patient Deductible
paid_by_primary 0..1integerPaid by Primary
paid_ingredient_cost 0..1integerPaid Ingredent Cost
paid_dispensing_fee 0..1integerPaid Dispensing Fee
payer_plan_period_id 0..1Reference(Payer Plan Period OMOP Table)Payer Plan Period
amount_allowed 0..1integerAmount Allowed
revenue_code_concept_id 0..1Reference(Concept OMOP Table)Revenue Code
revenue_code_source_value 0..1stringRevenue Code Source Value
drg_concept_id 0..1integerDiagnosis Related Groups
drg_source_value 0..1stringDiagnosis Related Groups Source Value

Documentation for this format

name: Cost
title: Cost OMOP Table
description:
The COST table captures records containing the cost of any medical event recorded in one of the OMOP clinical event tables such as DRUG_EXPOSURE, PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE, VISIT_OCCURRENCE, VISIT_DETAIL, DEVICE_OCCURRENCE, OBSERVATION or MEASUREMENT.

Each record in the cost table account for the amount of money transacted for the clinical event. So, the COST table may be used to represent both receivables (charges) and payments (paid), each transaction type represented by its COST_CONCEPT_ID. The COST_TYPE_CONCEPT_ID field will use concepts in the Standardized Vocabularies to designate the source (provenance) of the cost data. A reference to the health plan information in the PAYER_PLAN_PERIOD table is stored in the record for information used for the adjudication system to determine the persons benefit for the clinical event.

element.definition:
The COST table captures records containing the cost of any medical event recorded in one of the OMOP clinical event tables such as DRUG_EXPOSURE, PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE, VISIT_OCCURRENCE, VISIT_DETAIL, DEVICE_OCCURRENCE, OBSERVATION or MEASUREMENT.

Each record in the cost table account for the amount of money transacted for the clinical event. So, the COST table may be used to represent both receivables (charges) and payments (paid), each transaction type represented by its COST_CONCEPT_ID. The COST_TYPE_CONCEPT_ID field will use concepts in the Standardized Vocabularies to designate the source (provenance) of the cost data. A reference to the health plan information in the PAYER_PLAN_PERIOD table is stored in the record for information used for the adjudication system to determine the persons benefit for the clinical event.
Revenue codes are a method to charge for a class of procedures and conditions in the U.S. hospital system.
Diagnosis Related Groups are US codes used to classify hospital cases into one of approximately 500 groups.
